input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Having a brother has a direct effect on wife and alarm clock. Wife has a direct effect on alarm clock. For people who do not have a brother, the probability of ringing alarm is 80%. For people who have a brother, the probability of ringing alarm is 26%. Will having a brother increase the chance of ringing alarm?
